div.l: And namely ther was a gret collagge
Men clepeth the soler halle at cantebregge
Ther was hir whete and eek hire malte y grounde
And on a day it happed on a stounde
Sike lay the manciple on a maladye
Men wende wisli that he sholde dye
For whiche this Millere stalle both mele and corn
An hundred tyme more than bi forn
For ther biforn he stal but curteisly
But now he was a thef outraously
For whiche the warden chidde and made fare
But there of the myller͗e sette nat a tare
He craked boost and swoor it nas nat so
Then were ther yonge poure scolers two
That dwellen in the halle of which y seie
Testyf thei were and lusty for to pleie
And oonly for hir merthe and reuelrie
Vp on the warden bisily thei crie
To yeue hem leue but a litel stounde
To go to mylle and seen hir corn grounde
And hardily thei durste lay hir nekke
The Miller͗e sholde nat stele hem half a pecke
Of corn bi sleight ne bi force hem reue
And at the last the warden yaf hem leue
Iohn hight that on and Aleyn hight that other
Of on toun were thei born that hight Strother
Fer in the north I kan nat telle where
This Aleyn maketh redy al his gere
And on his hors the sak he caste a non
Forth gothe Aleyn the clerk and also Iohn
With good swerd and with bokeler by hir side
Iohn knew the weye hem neded no gide
And at the Mille the sak a doun he laith
Aleyn spak first alhaal Symond in faith
